_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Paper
author: parker@pterodactyl.io
description: High performance Spigot fork that aims to fix gameplay and mechanics inconsistencies.

installation.script:
#!/bin/ash
# Paper Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
PROJECT="paper"
USER_AGENT="pterodactyl-installer/1.0"

if [ -n "${DL_PATH}" ]; then
    echo -e "Using supplied download url: ${DL_PATH}"
    DOWNLOAD_URL=$(eval echo $(echo ${DL_PATH} | sed -e 's/{{/${/g' -e 's/}}/}/g'))
else
    # API Logic (fill.papermc.io)

    # 1. Resolve Version if "latest" or empty
    if [ -z "${MINECRAFT_VERSION}" ] || [ "${MINECRAFT_VERSION}" == "latest" ]; then
        echo "Resolving latest version for ${PROJECT}..."
        VERSIONS=$(curl -s -H "User-Agent: ${USER_AGENT}" https://fill.papermc.io/v3/projects/${PROJECT} | \
            jq -r '.versions | to_entries[] | .value[]' | \
            sort -V -r)
        
        for VERSION in $VERSIONS; do
            MINECRAFT_VERSION=$VERSION
            break
        done
    fi

    echo "Target Version: ${MINECRAFT_VERSION}"

    # 2. Check if the requested version has a stable build
    BUILDS_RESPONSE=$(curl -s -H "User-Agent: $USER_AGENT" https://fill.papermc.io/v3/projects/${PROJECT}/versions/${MINECRAFT_VERSION}/builds)

    # Check if the API returned an error
    if echo "$BUILDS_RESPONSE" | jq -e '.ok == false' > /dev/null 2>&1; then
        ERROR_MSG=$(echo "$BUILDS_RESPONSE" | jq -r '.message // "Unknown error"')
        echo "Error: $ERROR_MSG"
        exit 1
    fi

    # Try to get a stable build URL for the requested version
    PAPERMC_URL=$(echo "$BUILDS_RESPONSE" | jq -r 'first(.[] | select(.channel == "STABLE") | .downloads."server:default".url) // "null"')
    FOUND_VERSION="$MINECRAFT_VERSION"

    # 3. If no stable build for requested version, find the latest version with a stable build
    if [ "$PAPERMC_URL" == "null" ]; then
        echo "No stable build for version $MINECRAFT_VERSION, searching for latest version with stable build..."

        # Get all versions for the project
        VERSIONS=$(curl -s -H "User-Agent: $USER_AGENT" https://fill.papermc.io/v3/projects/${PROJECT} | \
            jq -r '.versions | to_entries[] | .value[]' | \
            sort -V -r)

        # Iterate through versions to find one with a stable build
        for VERSION in $VERSIONS; do
            VERSION_BUILDS=$(curl -s -H "User-Agent: $USER_AGENT" https://fill.papermc.io/v3/projects/${PROJECT}/versions/${VERSION}/builds)

            # Check if this version has a stable build
            STABLE_URL=$(echo "$VERSION_BUILDS" | jq -r 'first(.[] | select(.channel == "STABLE") | .downloads."server:default".url) // "null"')

            if [ "$STABLE_URL" != "null" ]; then
                PAPERMC_URL="$STABLE_URL"
                FOUND_VERSION="$VERSION"
                echo "Found stable build for version $VERSION"
                break
            fi
        done
    fi

    if [ "$PAPERMC_URL" != "null" ]; then
        DOWNLOAD_URL=$PAPERMC_URL
    else
        echo "No stable builds available for any version :("
        exit 1
    fi
fi

cd /mnt/server
echo -e "Running curl -o ${SERVER_JARFILE} ${DOWNLOAD_URL}"

if [ -f ${SERVER_JARFILE} ]; then
    mv ${SERVER_JARFILE} ${SERVER_JARFILE}.old
fi

curl -o ${SERVER_JARFILE} ${DOWNLOAD_URL}

if [ ! -f server.properties ]; then
    echo -e "Downloading MC server.properties"
    curl -o server.properties https://raw.githubusercontent.com/parkervcp/eggs/master/minecraft/java/server.properties
fi

variables.name: Minecraft Version
variables.description:
The version of minecraft to download. 

Leave at latest to always get the latest version. Invalid versions will default to latest.

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: The name of the server jarfile to run the server with.

variables.name: Download Path
variables.description: A URL to use to download a server.jar rather than the ones in the install script. This is not user viewable.

variables.name: Build Number
variables.description:
The build number for the paper release.

Leave at latest to always get the latest version. Invalid versions will default to latest.
